articles.title: Kim Jong Un reaffirms denuclearization push - CNN Video
articles.description: South Korea's President says North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is still committed to complete denuclearization and wants to meet with President Trump.

articles.title: What is Kim Jong Un's red line? - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN national security analyst Sam Vinograd takes a look at how the US should approach Kim Jong Un ahead of a potential June 12 summit.

articles.author: Joe Palazzolo
articles.title: Stormy Daniels’s Lawyer Michael Avenatti Complicates Michael Cohen Probe
articles.description: Michael Avenatti, a lawyer for former adult-film star Stephanie Clifford, has frustrated efforts by federal prosecutors investigating President Donald Trump’s personal lawyer to get information about a hush-money deal with his client, people familiar with the…

articles.title: Truckers’ Strike Paralyzes Brazil as President Courts Investors
articles.description: Brazil, which has Latin America’s largest economy, has been crippled as truck drivers protesting rising fuel prices have blocked roads across the country.

articles.author: Vivian Salama
articles.title: Nations Race to Save Korea Summit
articles.description: The U.S. decided to defer launching a major new sanctions push against North Korea, part of a flurry of weekend moves by both sides aimed at reviving a summit between President Trump and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Year's first named Atlantic storm hits US
articles.description: Thousands of people are evacuated as Alberto strikes north-western Florida's coast.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/amy-harmon
articles.title: Did the Trump Administration Separate Immigrant Children From Parents and Lose Them?
articles.description: Federal officials have lost track of nearly 1,500 children, but those children arrived at the border alone.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/julie-hirschfeld-davis, http://www.nytimes.com/by/maggie-haberman
articles.title: Trump Pulls Conspiracy Theories From the Fringes to the Oval Office
articles.description: The president’s promotion of the unconfirmed claims he calls “Spygate” continues a long history of presidential trafficking in tales of shadowy cabals and secret plots.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Police probed as woman punched in arrest
articles.description: Police open an inquiry as an officer is filmed hitting a woman in the head in an arrest on a US beach.

articles.author: Drew Hinshaw
articles.title: On Abortion Rights, Ireland Has Mirror Image in Conservative Poland
articles.description: Irish voters’ move to legalize abortion reverberated in Poland, another Roman Catholic-majority country in Europe, but one where the procedure is broadly illegal.

articles.author: Rolfe Winkler
articles.title: In ‘Founder Friendly’ Era, Star Tech Entrepreneurs Grab Power, Huge Pay
articles.description: There has been a profound shift of power from Silicon Valley financiers to star entrepreneurs, who are increasingly wresting control of their companies from venture-capital backers and extracting huge pay packages tied to going public.

articles.author: Kevin Liptak, CNN
articles.title: Trump ramps up pressure to get North Korea summit on track
articles.description: A heightened level of presidential urgency is spurring discussions among American and North Korean counterparts two weeks ahead of an off-again, on-again summit between President Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/kimiko-de-freytas-tamura, https://www.nytimes.com/by/alan-cowell
articles.title: After Ireland Abortion Vote, Northern Irish Ask, ‘Why Not Us?’
articles.description: Last week’s referendum liberalizing Ireland’s abortion laws has energized abortion rights advocates in the North and created headaches for Prime Minister Theresa May.

articles.author: Ben Fritz
articles.title: ‘Solo,’ Newest ‘Star Wars’ Installment, Off to a Slow Start
articles.description: “Solo: A Star Wars Story” opened to an estimated $103 million in the U.S. and Canada over the long Memorial Day weekend.

articles.author: Keach Hagey
articles.title: Once Allies, Two Media Chiefs Go to War Over the Future of CBS
articles.description: Shari Redstone and Les Moonves are locked in a legal battle triggered by their disagreement over a potential merger of Viacom and the broadcasting powerhouse. The outcome could determine whether the Redstone family continues to exercise control over CBS.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Abramovich 'eligible to become Israeli'
articles.description: The Russian billionaire owner of Chelsea FC had faced delays in renewing his UK visa.

articles.author: Michelle Ye Hee Lee
articles.title: South Korea’s President Moon is the man in the (very precarious) middle
articles.description: Moon tries to keep U.S.-North Korea summit on track but draws some criticism.

articles.author: Heather Long
articles.title: Analysis | America has a massive truck driver shortage. Here’s why few want an $80,000 job.
articles.description: America has a shortage of 51,000 truck drivers. The job pays a middle-class wage, yet few people want it. Six drivers explain why.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: Donald Trump just put the 'Me' in his Memorial Day tweet
articles.description: Memorial Day, for politicians, is a no-brainer. You express thanks to those who have served and condolences for those who have been lost. That's it. That's the statement.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/motoko-rich
articles.title: Trump and Abe to Meet Before North Korea Summit
articles.description: The Japanese leader hopes to influence Mr. Trump on issues like North Korean short-range missiles that could hit Japan.
